elements.title: Reverend Thomas Sparshott
elements.contents: ... that English missionary Reverend Thomas Sparshott co-wrote a book in Swahili, and his daughter Margaret Elwyn Sparshott (pictured) was responsible as matron for 22 hospitals in World War I?

elements.title: moving prime time up an hour
elements.contents: ... that in the early 1990s, several TV stations in Northern California experimented with moving prime time up an hour?

elements.title: Louise Fulton
elements.contents: ... that Louise Fulton was the first African-American to win a professional bowling tournament?

elements.title: a train from derailing
elements.contents: ... that in 1936, a dairy farmer unsuccessfully attempted to cut a signal wire to prevent a train from derailing as it approached a landslide in New Zealand?

elements.title: Sara Mérida
elements.contents: ... that footballer Sara Mérida played for Espanyol Femení, was a physiotherapist for the club, and ultimately helped coach her former team to promotion in 2022?

elements.title: a small church
elements.contents: ... that a 1937 proposal to name a small church in Bremen after Horst Wessel provoked a fierce dispute with the local Nazi Party leadership?

elements.title: Cybermorph
elements.contents: ... that a landscape demo created by Attention to Detail for the Konix Multisystem became the basis for Cybermorph on Atari Jaguar?

elements.title: Wisconsin Butter Fire
elements.contents: ... that the Wisconsin Butter Fire created a river of melted butter in Madison?
